required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Master Protocol (AMAZ): A Study of Mirikizumab (LY3074828) in Pediatric Participants With Ulcerative Colitis or Crohn's Disease (SHINE-ON)
clinical_study.official_title: A Master Protocol for a Phase 3, Multicenter, Open-label, Long-term Extension Study to Evaluate the Long-term Efficacy and Safety of Mirikizumab in Children and Adolescents With Moderate-to-severe Ulcerative Colitis or Crohn's Disease

brief_summary.textblock: The main purpose of this study is to evaluate the long-term efficacy of mirikizumab in pediatric participants with ulcerative colitis (UC) or Crohn's disease (CD). The study will last about 172 weeks and may include up to 44 visits.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants with UC in Modified Mayo Score (MMS) Clinical Remission
primary_outcome.description: Clinical Remission based on the Modified Mayo Score (MMS)

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants with UC in MMS Clinical Remission
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical Remission based on the MMS

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants with UC in MMS Clinical Response
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical Response based on the MMS

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants with UC in Pediatric Ulcerative Colitis Activity Index (PUCAI) Clinical Response
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical Response based on the PUCAI

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants with UC in PUCAI Clinical Remission
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical Remission based on the PUCAI

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants with UC in Endoscopic Remission
secondary_outcome.description: Endoscopic Remission based on the Endoscopic Subscore (ES)

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants with UC in Endoscopic Response
secondary_outcome.description: Endoscopic Response based on the ES

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants with UC in having Endoscopic Subscore = 0
Percentage of Participants with UC Experiencing Histologic-Endoscopic Mucosal Remission
secondary_outcome.description: Histologic remission based on histology scoring and endoscopic subscore

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants with UC in Corticosteroid-free Remission Without Surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Corticosteroid-free Remission based on MMS in participants who did not have an ulcerative colitis (UC)-related surgery

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Body Weight
secondary_outcome.description: Body weight change from baseline at Week 52 in participants with UC
Height Velocity measured in centimeters/year in participants with UC

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in Hormone levels at approximate 6-month intervals until growth is complete
secondary_outcome.description: Estradiol or testosterone levels change from baseline at Week 52 in participants with UC

arm_group.description: Dose 1 of Mirikizumab is administered subcutaneously (SC) Dosing is based on the assessments of the participant's weight.
Dose 2 of Mirikizumab is administered SC Dosing is based on the assessments of the participant's weight.
Dose 3 of Mirikizumab is administered SC Dosing is based on the assessments of the participant's weight.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Participants from originating studies (I6T-MC-AMBU [NCT04004611]) who should, in the opinion of the investigator, derive clinical benefit from further treatment with mirikizumab
- Participants from prior studies who have had at least one study drug administration and have not had early termination of study drug.
- Female participants must agree to contraception requirements.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Participants must not have developed a new condition, including cancer in the originator study.
- Participants must not have any important infections including, but not limited to, hepatitis B, hepatitis C, HIV/AIDS, and active tuberculosis (TB) during either originator study.
- Participants must not have received surgery for UC in the originator study or are likely to require surgery for treatment of UC during the study.
- Participants must not require parenteral nutrition delivered by central vein and/or central venous catheter for venous access.

link.description: A Master Protocol (AMAZ): A Study of Mirikizumab (LY3074828) in Pediatric Participants With Ulcerative Colitis or Crohn's Disease (SHINE-ON)

patient_data.ipd_description: Anonymized individual patient level data will be provided in a secure access environment upon approval of a research proposal and a signed data sharing agreement.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Data are available 6 months after the primary publication and approval of the indication studied in the US and European Union (EU), whichever is later. Data will be indefinitely available for requesting.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: A research proposal must be approved by an independent review panel and researchers must sign a data sharing agreement.
